subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Niklas Backstrom made 36 saves and Antti Pihlstrom and Janne Niskala scored in the first period for Finland, which beat Sweden, 4-0, for the bronze medal at the world championship in Quebec City. Afterward, Finland’s Teemu Selanne announced his retirement from international play, but said he might still play in the N.H.L. Canada and Russia play for the gold medal Sunday.
